word: It has come to our attention
str2: Of time: when, now, after that; of cause: seeing that, forasmuch as. From epei and de; since now, i.e. when, or whereas.
Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

parse: Interrogative / Indefinite Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: Any one, some one, a certain one or thing. An enclitic indefinite pronoun; some or any person or object.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
From out, out from among, from, suggesting from the interior outwards. A primary preposition denoting origin, from, out.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Middle - 1st Person Plural
str2: To give a commission (instructions), order; To admonish, prohibit.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: From ana and a derivative of skeuos; properly, to pack up, i.e. to upset.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
From lego; something said; by implication, a topic, also reasoning or motive; by extension, a computation; specially, the Divine Expression.
